meanings.definition: To have a tendency or inclination
meanings.sent1: She tends to wake up early every morning.
meanings.sent2: He tends to get nervous before big presentations.
meanings.sent3: The cat tends to think it's the boss of the house.
meanings.sent4: His mind tends to wander like a lost puppy.
meanings.sent5: The old clock tends to chime at odd hours.

meanings.sent1: The child tends to prefer playing outside.
meanings.sent2: My grandma tends to enjoy knitting in the evenings.
meanings.sent3: The car tends to act up when it's cold outside.
meanings.sent4: His heart tends to beat faster when he sees her.
meanings.sent5: The tree tends to sway gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To move or extend in a certain direction
meanings.sent1: The river tends to flow towards the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sunflower tends to turn towards the sun.
meanings.sent3: The kite tends to soar high up in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The vine tends to creep along the garden wall.
meanings.sent5: The road tends to wind through the forest.
